title.narrative: Resilience and Integral Ecology Capacity Strengthening for partners in Zambia

description.narrative:
"We are not faced with two separate crises, one environmental and one social, but rather with one complex crisis which is both social and environmental. Strategies for a solution demand an integral approach to combating poverty, restoring dignity to the excluded, and at the same time protecting nature” (LS 139). “Today, we have to realise that a true ecological approach always becomes a social approach; it must integrate questions of justice in debates on the environment, so as to hear both the cry of the earth and the cry of the poor” (LS 49).
Based on this call of the Laudato Si, CAFOD is now applying a resilience lens that encourages staff and partners to look holistically at issues of poverty and injustice in communities, understand their drivers and root causes, design responses that reflects the inter-connected nature of these challenges and ultimately strengthen the capacity of communities to anticipate threats, adapt and flourish. The training is therefore aimed to strengthen the Resilience capacities of partners to ensure that their project design encompass; (a) poverty reduction, (b) natural resource protection and equitable access and use through more environmentally friendly interventions, (c) local CSO’s and communities become aware of their rights and hold governments to account, linking advocacy / policy influencing to thematic programming.
